alert.note: Alert for Burns BLM; Vale BLM (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued July 21 at 12:46PM PDT until July 24 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY COULD CREATE CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... .Gusty westerly winds will likely increase across southwestern Idaho and extreme southeastern Oregon, especially near the NV border, on Sunday and Monday afternoon with low relative humidity, possibly resulting in critical fire weather conditions. Isolated thunderstorms with gusty outflow winds and little rainfall will be an additional concern, mainly in southwestern Idaho, on Sunday afternoon-evening. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH MONDAY EVENING FOR...GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITIES FOR BURNS BLM AND VALE BLM...WHICH ARE FIRE WEATHER ZONES 636 AND 637... The National Weather Service in Boise has issued a Fire Weather Watch, which is in effect from Sunday afternoon through Monday evening. * WINDS... Southwest to west winds 10 to 20 mph with gusts up to 35 mph Sunday and Monday afternoon and evening. A brief reduction in winds is expected on Sunday night and Monday morning. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...10 to 15 percent.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are possible. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.
